intro: Phyllanthus nothisii var. alticola, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant has alternate, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
